results.title: Doctor Who: death to the Daleks
results.brief_description: In this exciting adventure the Doctor (Jon Pertwee) is forced into a desperate race against time… An inexplicable power loss strands the tardis on the sinister planet Exxilon where the Doctor meets an expedition from Earth seeking a rare mineral that can cure the virulent space plague that threatens all human life. Nearby Sarah (Elisabeth Sladen) discovers a mysterious Citadel but is captured by the savage Exxilons who prepare for her sacrifice. The Doctor must uncover the secrets of the ancient city, locate the source of the power drain, save Sarah and help the Earth expedition. But his plans are threatened by new arrivals on the planet - the Doctor’s oldest and deadliest enemies - the Daleks.

results.title: Doctor Who: city of death
results.brief_description: A peaceful holiday in Paris takes a macabre turn for the Doctor and Romama (Tom Baker, Lala Ward) as cracks start to appear in the fabric of time itself. Uncovering a plot by the sinister Count (Julian Glover), to steal the Mona Lisa, the Doctor goes on a dangerous quest which takes him four hundred million years into the past. These four cleverly written episodes are by David Agnew, a.k.a. Douglas Adams of ‘Hitchhikers guide to the Galaxy’ fame, and includes cameo appearances by John Cleese and Elanor Bron. Douglas Adams would later re-work this story into his novel: ‘Dirk Gently’s Holistic Detective Agency’.

results.title: Doctor Who & the Daleks
results.brief_description: The Doctor (Peter Cushing), with his two granddaughters, Barbara and Susan, and Barbara’s bumbling boyfriend, Ian, accidently set off on a journey through time in the Tardis- destination unknown. Landing on a planet of gloomy surroundings they come across the Daleks who are searching for a cure to protect them from radiation sickness- of which their planet is saturated. The other inhabitants of the planet, the Thal, have a drug to cure radition sickness and the Daleks will stop at nothing to obtain the information. A colourful, comical and serious film adaptation of the popular long running television serial. Starring Peter Cushing, Roberta Tovey, Jennie Linden and Ray Castle.

results.title: Doctor Who
results.brief_description: The adventures of a Time Lord — a time-travelling humanoid alien known as the Doctor — who explores the universe in his TARDIS, a sentient time-travelling space ship. Along with a succession of companions, the Doctor saves civilisations, helps ordinary people and rights wrongs.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.description: The adventures of a Time Lord — a time-travelling humanoid alien known as the Doctor — who explores the universe in his TARDIS, a sentient time-travelling space ship. Its exterior appears as a blue British police box, which was a common sight in Britain in 1963 when the series first aired. Along with a succession of companions, the Doctor faces a variety of foes while working to save civilisations, help ordinary people, and right wrongs.
description_for_label: The adventures of a Time Lord — a time-travelling humanoid alien known as the Doctor — who explores the universe in his TARDIS, a sentient time-travelling space ship. Along with a succession of companions, the Doctor faces a variety of foes while working to save civilisations, help ordinary people, and right wrongs.

results.title: Doctor Who
results.brief_description: The Doctor is a Time Lord: a 900 year old alien with two hearts, part of a gifted civilisation who mastered time travel. The Doctor saves planets for a living – more of a hobby actually, and the Doctor’s very, very good at it.

constellations_other.name: Like a puppet on a string
constellations_other.description: From the silly to the sinister, puppets, muppets, dummies and toys on-screen.

results.description: The Doctor is a Time Lord: a 900 year old alien with two hearts, part of a gifted civilisation who mastered time travel. The Doctor saves planets for a living – more of a hobby actually, and the Doctor’s very, very good at it.

results.title: Doctor Sleep
results.brief_description: A traumatized, alcoholic Dan Torrance meets Abra, a kid who also has the ability to “shine.” He tries to protect her from the True Knot, a cult whose goal is to feed off of people like them in order to remain immortal.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

results.title: Doctor Jekyll and sister Hyde
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Brian Clemens, Albert Fennell and Hammer
results.brief_description: This unusual twist on Robert Louis Stevenson’s often filmed Doctor Jekyll and Mr Hyde also incorporates the Jack the Ripper mythology into it’s narrative. This time around the ‘good’ doctor Jekyll (Ralph Bates) is experimenting with female hormones in his quest for the elixir of youth, when things start to go horribly wrong. His experiment transforms him not into a hideous monster but a beautiful woman (Martine Beswick), giving the film an unexpected gender-bending twist. Of course the doctor spends much of his time in front of the mirror admiring his new breasts, while the upkeep of his new persona sends him into a grisly killing spree. Cast includes Gerald Sim, Lewis Fiander, Susan Broderick, Dorothy Alison.

results.title: Doctor Dolittle (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a charming fantasy excursion which creates a wonderful world of endless imagination through music, dance and special effects. Rex Harrison stars in the madcap adventures of a 19th century English doctor who walks and talks and squarks with the animals. Based on the stories of Hugh Lofting, the good doctor gets himself into all sorts of funny predicaments in this fun film that earned an Academy Award nomination for Best Picture. With terrific music, fine acting, loveable creatures and a joyous fantasy tale, “Doctor Doolittle” is a classic for young and old alike.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fleischer, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Doctor Dolittle
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This is a charming fantasy excursion which creates a wonderful world of endless imagination through music, dance and special effects. Rex Harrison stars in the madcap adventures of a 19th century English doctor who walks and talks and squawks with the animals. Based on the stories of Hugh Lofting, the good doctor gets himself into all sorts of funny predicaments in this fun film that earned an Academy Award nomination for Best Picture. With terrific music, fine acting, lovable creatures and a joyous fantasy tale, “Doctor Doolittle” is a classic for young and old alike.
Cast also includes: Samantha Eggar, Anthony Newley, Peter Bull and Richard Attenborough.

results.title: Doctor De Soto and 5 other funny stories
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s circle”.
A collection of animated short stories for children. “Doctor De Soto” by William Steig. The kind-hearted mouse Doctor De Soto is a dentist. He and his wife find a very clever way to treat a crafty fox, who comes to them with a sore tooth and secret thoughts of eating them after the job is done. This outstanding cartoon was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film. “Patrick” by Quentin Blake. When Patrick plays his fiddle, the countryside comes alive with vibrant colour and motion. “The Hat” by Tomi Ungerer. Penniless Benito finds good fortune when he comes upon a magic black hat with which he can perform fantastic feats. “Smile for Auntie” by Diane Paterson. Silly Auntie sings, dances, makes funny faces, stands on her head - anything to get the baby to smile! “The Foolish Frog” by Pete And Charles Seeger. Folk singer Pete Seeger plays and sings this catchy song about the frog who fell in the mud, to the delightful drawings of Mioslav Jagr. “Leopold the See-through Crumb-picker” by James Flora. Leopold is invisible and devours every crumb he finds, creating havoc in the process. See what happens when a little girl befriends him.
